task.name: hif_lowgainflag
task.shortdescription: Flag antennas with low or high gain
task.description: Flag antennas with low or high gain.

param.name: intent
param.description: Data intent whose gains are to checked

param.name: spw
param.description: Spectral window ids whose gains are to be checked

param.name: flag_nmedian
param.description: True to flag values outside range [fnm_lo_limit * median, fnm_hi_limit*nmedian]

param.name: fnm_lo_limit
param.description: Flag values lower than fnm_lo_limit * median

param.name: fnm_hi_limit
param.description: Flag values higher than fnm_hi_limit * median

param.name: dryrun
param.description: Run the task (False) or list commands(True)

task.example:
hif_lowgainflag flags data for antennas with unusually low or high gains.
Keyword arguments:
pipelinemode -- The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In interactive mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task. default: 'automatic'.
---- pipeline parameter arguments which can be set in any pipeline mode
intent -- The data intent to be checked for antennas with low gain. The default is blank, which causes the task to select the first intent in the list ['BANDPASS', 'PHASE', 'AMPLITUDE'] for which data are found. default ''
flag_nmedian -- True to flag figures of merit greater than fnm_hi_limit * median or lower than fnm_lo_limit * median. default True
fnm_lo_limit -- Points lower than fnm_lo_limit * median are flagged. default 0.7
fnm_hi_limit -- Points greater than fnm_hi_limit * median are flagged. default 1.3
---- pipeline context defined parameter arguments which can be set only in 'interactive mode'
-- Pipeline task execution modes
dryrun -- Run the commands (True) or generate the commands to be run but do not execute (False). default: True
acceptresults -- Add the results of the task to the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False). default: True
Output:
results -- If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.
Description Deviant antennas are detected by analysis of a view showing their calibration gains. This view is a list of 2D images with axes 'Time' and 'Antenna'; there is one image for each spectral window and intent. A flagcmd to flag all data for an antenna will be generated by any gain that is outside the range [fnm_lo_limit * median, fnm_hi_limit * median].
